headline: Perfect Chicken Piccata
description: Briny capers and a tangy lemon sauce top tender pieces of breaded chicken in this easy, restaurant-quality recipe for chicken piccata. The sauce is so addicting, you'll want to drink it!

video.description: Briny capers and a tangy, fresh lemon sauce top tender pieces of breaded chicken in this easy, restaurant-quality recipe for chicken piccata.
video.name: You Can Make This Classic Chicken Piccata In Under 30 Minutes | You Can Cook That | Allrecipes.com

name: Perfect Chicken Piccata
recipeIngredient: 4 (4 ounce) boneless, skinless chicken breast halves
0.25 cup dry white wine, such as Pinot Grigio

recipeInstructions.text: Slice chicken breasts in half lengthwise and lightly pound to 1/2-inch thick. Season evenly on both sides with salt and pepper. Dredge each piece in flour to coat the surface and shake off any excess flour.

Heat 2 tablespoons oil and 1 1/2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat until just beginning to smoke. Add 1/2 of the chicken and cook, undisturbed, until browned and easily released from the skillet, 2 1/2 to 3 minutes. Flip and cook for 2 more minutes. Remove from the skillet. Add remaining 1 tablespoon oil to the drippings and repeat the cooking process with remaining chicken. Reserve all chicken on a plate.

Reduce heat to medium and melt remaining 1 1/2 tablespoons butter in the skillet. Add wine and capers and stir, scraping to release any browned bits from the skillet; bring to a simmer. Cook for 2 minutes to slightly reduce. Add chicken stock, lemon juice, and lemon zest; stir to combine. Bring to a simmer and cook for 2 minutes.
Return chicken to the skillet and cook, turning occasionally in the sauce, until chicken is no longer pink in the center, the juices run clear, and the sauce has thickened slightly, 3 to 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and sprinkle with parsley to serve.

review.reviewBody: This is an excellent recipe for chicken piccata! I made it with chicken cutlets for ease of prep. Tangy and bright, it is my go to recipe!
I followed every step , it was easy and delicious my families loved it

I made it to the recipe except I used chicken tenderloins to save time. It was really good and loved by all the family which is sometimes hard to do. Will definitely be making this on a regular basis.
Easy, tasty, and not much work. Goes great with an angel hair pesto.
Instead of flour (keto diet), I used almond flour and Psyllium husk for the sauce thickening

I just made it tonight. Very good and the sauce was delicious. Made it as directed but I used Knorr flavored rice and Broccoli. Easy to make and enough gravy to cover the rice and the brocolli. Easy but tasted so good!
The title of the recipe says it all; this IS the Perfect Chicken Piccata. Don’t mess it up with trying to be creative; just follow the recipe.
Love this recipe - so easy and very quick. Most ingredients in the kitchen already. Who doesn't like pasta and then the sauce is so perfect. Just too easy to make and re-make!

I've been making this recipe for years, it's excellent -- be sure to try it with fish as well - Sea Bass, Mahi or Flounder Piccata is wonderful! Also, panko or cracker crumbs mixed with flour works and offers more texture.

I make this dish every month. Very standard recipe. Would have given it 5 stars with the addition of 3 cloves garlic crushed, sliced, or minced your choice, added to the pan. Bloom for 30 seconds. Add the wine. I'm not a big fan of Pinot Grigio so I bump up the flavor profile with a nice fruity riesling instead. Then add the stock after the alcohol burns off. Reduce and return chicken to pan. Cover with capers, as the chicken reheats. Add the lemon and zest for that bright tangy flavor at the end. Stir to combine. Serve.

I always order chicken piccata at Italian restaurants, but now I can make it at home. This is delicious! I followed the recipe exactly except for the parsley at the very end. I was too excited about eating that I forgot it!

Easy enough, watch your tempos and cooking time, as i used thinly sliced breast. I would go with a real hot skillet in the beginning one min on each side and flip one two max minute to ge that nice brown char, then lower flame. Follow recipe pretty much to T and all worked out, i did at the end add some asparagus tips and short stalks which came 9out good.
This was nice. Simple recipe with simple flavors that blend so nicely.
